qwirkle.gamelogic

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • qwirkle.gamelogic.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles everything related to a game. It can be started by creating a new game object, and giving the clients and the lobby from which it is spawned as parameters to the constructor.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int MAXHANDSIZE 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game(java.util.ArrayList<ClientHandler> clients, Lobby lobby)
      Game constructor, give clients and lobby as parameters so that the game can create its players and have a reference to the lobby from which it was created.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void broadcastNextTurn(ClientHandler currentClient, ClientHandler nextClient, Stone[] move)
      Send message to all clients, about who made a move, what move, and who is next.
      Stone[] changeStones(Stone[] stones)
      Changes out stones.
      Stone[] getFirstHand()
      Take stone from the bag.
      boolean hasPlayer(java.lang.String name)
      Checks whether the game has a certain player.
      void makeMove(Stone[] stones)
      Forwards a make move from a client, to the board.
      int makeMove(Stone[] stones, ClientHandler client)
      Forwards a make move from a client, to the board.
      void skipTurn(ClientHandler client)
      Takes a client as parameter, and skips the turn for this client.
      void startGame()
      Starts the game, giving turns to the right player.
      void terminateGame()
      Handles terminating the game, sends game end to all clients in game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(java.util.ArrayList<ClientHandler> clients,
            Lobby lobby)
        Game constructor, give clients and lobby as parameters so that the game can create its players and have a reference to the lobby from which it was created.
        Parameters:
        clients - Players in the game
        lobby - Lobby from which they were fetched

    • Method Detail

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        Starts the game, giving turns to the right player.

      • getFirstHand

        public Stone[] getFirstHand()
        Take stone from the bag.
        Returns:
        A newly composed array of stones for a hand

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove(Stone[] stones)
        Forwards a make move from a client, to the board.
        Parameters:
        stones - Stone array

      • makeMove

        public int makeMove(Stone[] stones,
                    ClientHandler client)
        Forwards a make move from a client, to the board.
        Parameters:
        stones - Stone array
        client - Clienthandler that makes a move
        Returns:
        int holding score of move (-1 if invalid)

      • changeStones

        public Stone[] changeStones(Stone[] stones)
        Changes out stones.

      • skipTurn

        public void skipTurn(ClientHandler client)
        Takes a client as parameter, and skips the turn for this client. Gives the turn to the next player in the row.
        Parameters:
        client - Clienthandler that skips a turn

      • broadcastNextTurn

        public void broadcastNextTurn(ClientHandler currentClient,
                              ClientHandler nextClient,
                              Stone[] move)
        Send message to all clients, about who made a move, what move, and who is next.
        Parameters:
        currentClient - ClientHandler that made a move
        nextClient - ClientHandler that gets the turn
        move - Move that currentClient made

      • terminateGame

        public void terminateGame()
        Handles terminating the game, sends game end to all clients in game.

      • hasPlayer

        public boolean hasPlayer(java.lang.String name)
        Checks whether the game has a certain player.
        Parameters:
        name - Player name to be found
        Returns:
        true if player is present in game
